frameDefinitions: These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
This frame includes words that name medical professionals and is closely related to the Medical_specialties frame.
An Agent acts to ensure that a Rule (often a constraint on behavior) is being followed.
In this frame an  Agent preserves a Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.
An Intoxicant is ingested in order to achieve an altered state of consciousness.
frameExamples: My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
Why don't we <t>enforce</t> the 20000 gun laws currently on the books across the nation?
listRoleDefinitions: The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This role identifies the medical <fen>Professional</fen>.
The <fen>Rule</fen> is the set of constrants on behavior that the <fen>Agent</fen> implements (i.e., forces others to obey or face consequences).
The <fen>Agent</fen>, often an institution, governmental organization, or arm thereof, puts into effect (i.e., enforces) a <fen>Rule</fen>.
This role describes the medium through which the rule was enforced.  It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Agent enforces the <fen>Rule</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Rule</fen> is or is not enforced.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the intentional act that leads to the preservation.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the substance in which the <fen>Patient</fen> might be  submerged to be preserved.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is organic matter that undergoes the preservation.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> preserves the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the preserving occurs.
The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> is ingested.
listRoleExamples: Employers should strictly enforce <fex>a prohibition against use of any substance that may affect a worker's physical or mental ability</fex>.
Can <fex>a landlord</fex> enforce rules upon tenants?
The rules will be enforced <fex>by a new computer system that tracks people's movements</fex>.
That particular regulation was only enforced <fex>in 1920</fex>.
For this reason they enforced the settlement system <fex>in America</fex> just as strictly as in Germany.
Mr. Amber embalmed the woman in Turkey <fex>in 1922</fex>.
Mr. Amber embalmed the woman's body <fex>in Turkey</fex> in 1922.
